title: Geography Challenge - Intermediate
description: Intermediate geography covering physical features, climate, and regions

questions.question: Which strait separates Europe and Asia at their closest point?
questions.explanation: The Bosphorus Strait in Turkey separates Europe and Asia at Istanbul.

questions.question: What type of climate is characterized by hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters?
questions.explanation: Mediterranean climate is characterized by dry summers and mild, wet winters.

questions.question: Which African country has three capital cities?
questions.explanation: South Africa has three capitals: Cape Town (legislative), Pretoria (executive), and Bloemfontein (judicial).

questions.question: The Ring of Fire is associated with which geological feature?
questions.explanation: The Ring of Fire is a region around the Pacific Ocean known for volcanic activity and earthquakes.

questions.question: Which South American country does NOT border the Pacific Ocean?
questions.explanation: Uruguay is located on the Atlantic coast of South America, not the Pacific.

questions.question: What is the term for a narrow strip of land connecting two larger land areas?
questions.explanation: An isthmus is a narrow strip of land connecting two larger areas, like the Isthmus of Panama.

questions.question: Which country has the most time zones?
questions.explanation: France has 12 time zones due to its overseas territories, more than any other country.

questions.question: The Tropic of Capricorn passes through which of these countries?
questions.explanation: The Tropic of Capricorn passes through Australia, along with several other southern hemisphere countries.

questions.question: Which sea is the saltiest body of water on Earth?
questions.explanation: The Dead Sea has a salinity of about 34%, making it one of the saltiest bodies of water.

questions.question: What causes the monsoon climate pattern?
questions.explanation: Monsoons are caused by seasonal reversals in wind direction due to temperature differences.
